frameDefinitions: An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
A Cognizer thinks that the Information given by a particular Source is correct.

A Billing_authority communicates in written form that the Debtor owes the Owed_party (often the same as the Billing_authority) some amount of Money for certain Goods (including services) provided by the Owed_party or to clear a debt for a Bad_action by the Debtor against the Owed_party.
A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.

An Agent is involved in an activity whose degree of success is dependent on a parameter of the action matching a particular set of values of a continuous variable or variables (e.g. quantity, location, time).
frameExamples: Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
The Longview Rangefinder is <t>accurate</t> to within one foot per hundred yards .
listRoleDefinitions: The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who has an opinion about the reliability of a <fen>Information_source</fen> or the <fen>Information</fen> from the <fen>Information_source</fen>.
An object or action associated with the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which is so affected by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s belief that it reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state.
The individual that gives Information to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The text or speech which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has heard and evaluates the truth of.
The person (or organization) that owes the <fen>Owed_party</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction, or as recompense for the <fen>Bad_action</fen>.
In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>.

The <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects a specific amount of <fen>Money</fen> from the <fen>Debtor</fen>, either because the <fen>Debtor</fen> received <fen>Goods</fen> or because the <fen>Debtor</fen> performed a Bad_action against the Owed_party.
The individual who communicates to the <fen>Debtor</fen> the <fen>Money</fen> that they owe.

An earlier action by the <fen>Debtor</fen> causing harm (directly or indirectly) to the <fen>Owed_party</fen>, for which the <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects compensation, and therefore bills the <fen>Debtor</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The individual who tries to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to hit a <fen>Target_value</fen>.
How closely the expected or actual location that the <fen>Instrument</fen> interacts with corresponds to the <fen>Target_value</fen>.
The object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
Expected or actual deviation from the <fen>Target_value</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when something hits or misses.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> manages or fails to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
Her trustworthy <fex>eyes</fex> revealed that I was in no danger.
America trusted <fex>his declaration</fex> , to their detriment .
The pizza man billed <fex>Lee</fex> $35 for his order.
The man at the counter billed Lee <fex>for his dry-cleaning</fex>.
The clerk invoiced the little old lady <fex>$49.95</fex> for what she called 'a little hand-holding . '
The cleaner bills <fex>at forty dollars per hour</fex> for his services.
<fex>The salesman</fex> never billed me , so I did n't pay .
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>The mailman</fex> is very exact about addresses -- he has to be .
For this they would need a thermometer accurate <fex>to within a microkelvin</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Master Key on Secure Desktop (Protection against Keyloggers
